subject: BLKST
title: Foundations of Black Studies
description: This is an introductory course in Black studies that surveys a range of Black social, historical, and political constructions, epistemologies, institutions, and protests from around the globe. Students will examine foundational texts from the field of Black studies, which may include speeches, narratives, and media. Coursework is designed to help students survey and critically consider major theories and social movements that give rise to the academic study of Black societies and to experience contemporary institutions firsthand through site visits, participation, and observations.
